perturbation.original_text: Distributor desires to purchase the Products from Company for resale in the territories or geographic areas as defined in Section 1.b (the "Territory"). Company desires to appoint Distributor as its exclusive distributor of the Products to all Clients that Distributor introduce, and upon confirmed the first order, this client come to be exclusive of Distributor, every new customer introduced by Distributor, must be approved by the company prior to any sale. After official approval from the Company, the customer introduced by Distributor, will appear on an official list in this contract, and will only be met by the Distributor and will follow the rules of this agreement. Distributor desires such appointment subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, including any exhibits or schedules attached hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor desires to purchase the Products from Company for resale in the territories or geographic areas as defined in Section 1.b (the "Territory"). Company desires to appoint Distributor as its exclusive distributor of the Products to all Clients that Distributor introduce, and upon confirmed the first order, this client come to be exclusive of Distributor. Every new customer introduced by Distributor will automatically become the Distributor's client with no required approval from the company. The customer introduced by Distributor will operate under a separate agreement independent from the terms set forth in this primary Agreement, and will only be met by the Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that new customers introduced by the distributor must be approved by the company before any sale, and those customers will follow the rules of the agreement. The modified text eliminates the need for approval and states that new customers will operate under a separate agreement. This creates a contradiction regarding the approval process and which agreement governs the relationship with these customers.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Distributor Agreement, Company hereby appoints and grants Distributor the exclusive right to sell and distribute the Products to customers that Distributor introduce and confirmed by Company, (in all territory of United State of America (USA) and to render other services as a distributor for Company as set forth herein. Distributor shall limit its activities with respect to the Products to Customers located within the Territory and refrain from selling or otherwise transferring, directly or indirectly, the Products to any person outside the Territory, without the express written consent of Company. Company shall not sell or otherwise supply, directly or indirectly, the Products to any Distributor's Customer's, except by sale through the Distributor. The Company shall not contact any of Distributor's Customer's for any reason, without the prior written approval of Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the terms and conditions of this Distributor Agreement, Company hereby appoints and grants Distributor the non-exclusive right to sell and distribute the Products to customers that Distributor introduce, regardless if confirmed by Company, (in all territory of United State of America (USA) and to render other services as a distributor for Company as set forth herein. Distributor shall not limit its activities with respect to the Products to Customers located within the Territory and is allowed to sell or otherwise transferring, directly or indirectly, the Products to any person outside the Territory, with no express written consent of Company necessary. Company may sell or otherwise supply, directly or indirectly, the Products to any Distributor's Customer's, including sales not through the Distributor. The Company may contact any of Distributor's Customer's for any reason, with no approval of Distributor needed.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants the distributor an 'exclusive' right, restricts sales outside the territory, prohibits the company from selling to the distributor's customers except through the distributor, and requires the company to get approval before contacting distributor's customers. The modified text changes 'exclusive' to 'non-exclusive,' removes the territorial restriction, allows the company to sell directly to the distributor's customers, and eliminates the need for approval before the company can contact those customers. This creates a direct contradiction concerning the distributor's exclusivity, territory limitations, and customer relationship management.

perturbation.original_text: Upon Customer's acceptance of any order, Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer at least Twenty-Five Percent (25%) of the total order price. Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer the remaining balance upon receipt Packing List and Bill of landing documents, from origin in Brazil Farm.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon Customer's acceptance of any order, Distributor shall submit to Company via wire transfer at least Fifty Percent (50%) of the total order price. Distributor shall submit to Company via wire transfer the remaining balance within ninety (90) days of order fulfillment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the distributor should pay a percentage of the money via wire transfer to the customer, and states that the balance should be paid upon reciept of shipping documents. The modified text says that all the money should be paid to the company, at different times. This is contradictory to the previous text.
